data.title: Any reasons why you do not use PRTG Network Monitor?
data.meta_description:
If you are monitoring your network using another product, are there any special reasons why you decided against PRTG? Or, if you do not monitor your network at all, is there a reason? 
@VMware   @HP   @SolarWinds   @Cisc…
data.text:
I do use PRTG… but I use V5.0.1.301 enterprise licensed for up to 500 sensors…

I haven’t upgraded for a couple of reasons - when I had a quick look at upgrading a while ago - you only seem to have a web application for it now, and I don’t like having web applications for things like this! I don’t really like web apps (except Spiceworks!).

I have a whole bunch of custom graphs set up that show the 8 most important network traffic on our network, and then I have the monitor up on a wall so we can all see it and act upon any unusual spikes in the data. I can’t really do this with a web app as it tends to stop updating after a while - or the browser crashes after being open too long. I liked it being a stand alone program that had a web interface - but by the looks of things, I will have to get used to web apps sooner or later.

Another reason is… PRTG 5 works… and it does what we want - why would I upgrade to 8 while it’s still working fine on 5?

And the final problem for me upgrading is quite simply - time! I don’t have time to test it - and 30 days isn’t enough for me to get it all installed and working so I can test it and work out if I want to keep it or look elsewhere for other software.
